title: LegalZoom
longdesc: LegalZoom is a disruptive online startup, providing legal services including Limited Liability Company (LLC) creation. User research—led by LegalZoom’s R&D department—uncovered deficiencies in their LLC landing page. The following proposal sought to communicate key benefits more succinctly and encourage Express Gold subscriptions, among other KPIs.

title: Hillbrush
longdesc: First established in 1922, Hillbrush is a cleaning tool manufacturer, now exporting to over 95 countries worldwide. The outcome of a strategic rebrand was a robust identity system, using monolithic brand architecture to gel a diverse portfolio. Immediate results were simpler product navigation across eCommerce, a 63% reduction in catalogue length and a clear relationship between previously abstract brands.

title: IBM
longdesc: IBM required a central platform for sharing their Storage division activities with Business Partners. It was aptly named Storage Zone and attributed a bold, vibrant identity. A componentised UI library was developed specifically for the platform, leveraging the IBM Design Language to ensure experiential continuity with other IBM products.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise
longdesc: As part of a strategic focus on high-performance computing, this HPE and NVIDIA campaign was directed at scientists with outdated simulation hardware. Display advertising was used across LinkedIn and ResearchGate, with these touchpoints leading to a microsite that captured data from gated content.

title: Lexonis
longdesc: Lexonis is a HR software house focused on competency management. After refreshing their identity, Lexonis required support with brand implementation, including a series of product leaflets and email communications.

title: CRM Knowledge
longdesc: CRM Knowledge is a consultancy practice that optimises CRM implementations. The campaign was a lead generation exercise targeting marketing managers and system administrators. To cater for differing audiences, communications were tailored and led to particular sections within a landing page. Organic traffic self-identified through the use of progressive disclosure within the content strategy.

title: Mio Interiors
longdesc: Mio Interiors is a design studio and retail outlet for luxury homeware brands. As part of the project to overhaul their website, Mio’s service areas were repackaged and design offering brought to the fore. This allowed the business to explore a new trajectory without upsetting their brand image.

title: Nieuwe Beelding
longdesc: Nieuwe Beelding was a self-initiated type design project inspired by painter Piet Mondrian. The typeface is geometric, adopting the strict visual language of Nieuwe Beelding (translated as Neoplasticism). Five weights were produced, ranging from Thin to Black, and presented using a foldout specimen booklet and range of creative posters. A microsite was later developed as a point of sale, allowing users to trial custom content in Nieuwe Beelding.

title: South West
longdesc: Proposal for former train operator, South West Trains, to elevate perceptions and stimulate growth. Custom lettering with gentle curves uses ligatures to mimic the linkage between train carriages. The longstanding colour palette was preserved, though rebalanced, to capitalise on prior efforts in brand awareness that would have built familiarity.
